quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Following and Law
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, pair, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does the phrase of biblical proportions mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: of a vast, enormous scale

questions.question: Which of the following can be described as a prodigal son?

options.text: The youngest son in the family
A young man who wastes his parents money on parties
A son that is very obedient and does dutifully everything his parents tell him

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A young man who wastes his parents money on parties

questions.question: Which use of Goliath is correct?

options.text: Switzerland is the Goliath of international politics.
The FIFA 2006 World Cup final between France and Italy was like David against Goliath.
The local grocery successfully competed against the nearby Goliath supermaket
Fiesta is a real Goliath among Fords models.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The local grocery successfully competed against the nearby Goliath supermaket

questions.question: What message am I conveying, if I say I dont know him from Adam?

options.text: I know very little about the person.
In spite of the negative form, the idiom means that you know someone very well.
The person is completely unknown to me.
I dont know his true character.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The person is completely unknown to me.

questions.question: What Biblical character said the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Esther

questions.question: Which of the following events can be referred to as an Armageddon?

options.text: A death of a charismatic leader
The last gathering of a group of friends
The last and completely destructive battle

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The last and completely destructive battle

questions.question: What kind of person may you call Judas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A friend who betrayed you

questions.question: Which of the following did Jesus call first to be his disciple?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Simon

questions.question: If John knows Mary in the biblical sense, what can we say about the pair?

options.text: Their parents decided about their marriage.
They are in a Platonic relationship (ie. love, but no sex).

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They have had sex.

questions.question: Who is the salt of the earth?

options.text: People who do not keep their word

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Decent, reliable people

questions.question: What does the sentence Ann was the apple of Marks eye tell us about the relation between those two?

options.text: Mark is deeply in love with Ann.
Ann is deeply in love with Mark.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark is deeply in love with Ann.

questions.question: Who can be best described as doubting Thomas?

options.text: Someone who believes only what he sees
Anyone who doesnt believe in God
A scientist (especially in physics, mathematics, chemistry and biology)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Someone who believes only what he sees

questions.question: According to the Bible, when Naomi told her two daughters-in-law to leave her and go to their homes, which daughter-in-law decided to stay?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ruth

questions.question: What characteristic is commonly attributed to King Solomon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wisdom

questions.question: How would you describe a Samaritan?

options.text: A person who helps people in need
A person who migrates to a foreign country

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A person who helps people in need

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Words and Character
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, mean, truth. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What character from the Bible said this?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martha

questions.question: In Buddhism which of these beings inhabit Hells?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Naraka beings

questions.question: Who said the following: It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick. But go and learn what this means: I desire mercy, not sacrifice. For I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jesus

questions.question: Name the Biblical character who delivered these words: Pick me up and throw me into the sea, and it will become calm, I know that is is my fault that this great storm has come upon you.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jonah

questions.question: Who delivered these words: Suppose I go to the Israelites and say to them, The God of your fathers has sent me to you, and they ask me, ‘What is his name? Then what shall I tell them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moses

questions.question: What Biblical character asked the following question?

options.text: I leading a rebellion, that you have come out with swords and clubs to capture me?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jesus

questions.question: What does the word buddha mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: awake

questions.question: According to Buddhism what are the3 evil roots/defilements that hide the truth from us?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: delusion, hatred, greed

questions.question: What Biblical hero delivered these words?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samson

questions.question: The following words belong to this biblical figure:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Job

questions.question: What is the symbol of the dhamma (dharma)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: wheel

questions.question: What character from the Bible said the following? Get rid of that slave woman and her son, for that slave womans son will never share in the inheritance with my son Isaac.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah

questions.question: What is the path to happiness in Buddhism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: middle way

questions.question: What Buddhist term refers to the cycle of reincarnation or rebirth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samsara

questions.question: What Biblical figure said this?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Issac

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Buddha and Antichrist
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, essance, hermione. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Antichrist; The Gay Science; Beyond Good and Evil; Thus Spoke Zarathustra
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frederick Nietzche

questions.question: Kamma is only one of the 5 natural laws that Buddha spoke about.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Return of the Native; Jude the Obscure; Far From the Madding Crowd
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Hardy

questions.question: 1984; Animal Farm
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Orwell

questions.question: It is generally accepted that the last words of the Buddha were: All component things are transient, work out your salvation with diligence.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: According to Buddhism there are realms of existences other than human and animal realm.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What does the word cretin refer to?

options.text: Swelling of the cerebrum caused by spinal fluid

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An idiot

questions.question: Hermione was supposed to turn into this person after drinking the Polyjuice Potion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Millicent Bulstrode

questions.question: At The Mountains of Madness
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: H.P. Lovecraft

questions.question: What was Hagrid buying in Knockturn Alley?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flesh-Eating Slug Repellent

questions.question: What language can Harry Potter speak?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parseltounge

questions.question: According to Buddhism, life is or leads to suffering in one way or another.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Ape and Essance; Eyeless in Gaza; Point Counter Point
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aldous Huxley

questions.question: Cornelia Fudge is the Minister of Magic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Leaves of Grass
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walt Whitman

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Book and George Orwell
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, villains, cruella. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This book by George Orwell was banned as it was pro-communist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1984

questions.question: Binding books with human hide was a common practice once. Why?

options.text: Because of lack of any other proper material
Because this sold the books more quickly than anything
Because the narrative in the book was about the story of the hides owner
Because it was fashionable at the time

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because the narrative in the book was about the story of the hides owner

questions.question: The name of Cruella de Vil from 101 Dalmatians is meaningful because:

options.text: She actually likes cats and not dogs
She is the owner of the dalmatians
She doesnt give them any food
She wants the puppies for their fur

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She wants the puppies for their fur

questions.question: This Lewis Carrolls work was banned in China because in it humans and animals used the same language.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alices Adventures in Wonderland

questions.question: Its translation into local languages was forbidden in Burma.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bible

questions.question: This book about the life of a prostitute was written by John Cleland. It has been banned in the past due to frank sexual descriptions.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fanny Hill

questions.question: Who is the Shakespearean villain who had his own brother executed and innocent children killed because they were hindrances to his kingly ambition?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard III

questions.question: An edition of Miltons works was bound in:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Human skin

questions.question: This book tells the story of two women who meet and fall in love with each other. They openly declare their homosexuality to family and friends. Thats why the Kansas school system ordered the removal of all copies of this book from high school libraries.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Annie on My Mind

questions.question: This book by James Joyce was forbidden by the US authorities for 15 years, because it was considered obsene. The ban was lifted in 1933.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulysses

questions.question: This book by Judy Blume was censored as it discussed adolescent sexuality in too much detail.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Forever

questions.question: This book was censored in 1985 in Cairo, Egypt as it contained obscene passages which posed a threat to the countrys moral fabric.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arabian Nights

questions.question: According to psychologists villains in fairy-tales actually have an important role for the childrens mind formation, namely:

options.text: They help children decide what is bad
They make the story really funny
They are interesting models of behaviour

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They help children decide what is bad

questions.question: This book led Austin Miles to the courts in 1992.  Miles was sued because his book was ...a vitriolic attack upon organized Christianity.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dont Call Me Brother

questions.question: The famous evil female Baba Yaga comes from:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Russian folklore

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Harry Potter and Harry
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, people, hermione. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Kathy Reichs has written some great mysteries, where the primary character is Forensic Archaeologist, Kay Scarpetta.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Harry Potter is concidered malicious literature by some, because:

options.text: Most of its characters are strange beings
Its characters are mainly clad in black clothes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is about witchcraft

questions.question: In Harry Potter and the Philosophers Stone, before Harry went to fight Professor Quirrel and He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named, Hermione helped him with a task that involved what?

options.text: A chess set by Professor Flitwick
An ancient textbook sent from Professor Binns
A set of potions sent from Professor Snape

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A set of potions sent from Professor Snape

questions.question: What is the name of Colin Creevys brother, who appears in the book Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dennis Creevy

questions.question: What did Hermione do to Ron before she stormed out of the charms classroom in Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince?

options.text: She charmed a desk to fly over to Ron.
She charmed pencils to fly and poke Ron.
She charmed little yellow birds to fly at Ron and peck him.
She charmed a chair to fly across the room at Ron.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She charmed little yellow birds to fly at Ron and peck him.

questions.question: Why was Hagrid missing in the beginning of Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix?

options.text: He went looking for Sirius Black.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He went hunting giants.

questions.question: Did Crabbe and Goyle ever become friends with Harry, Ron and Hermione in the Harry Potter books?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Who wrote about the early whodunit archetype, inspector Auguste Dupin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edgar Allan Poe

questions.question: Draco Malfoy cries in a book of the Harry Potter series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In Harry Potter and the Philosophers Stone, what was the password to the Gryffindor tower during Halloween?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pig snout

questions.question: Dr. Alex Delaware is the creation of which of these authors?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jonathan Kellerman

questions.question: Harry liked Cho in the book Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Robert B. Parker completed Raymond Chandlers unfinished final novel, Poodle Springs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: It turns out that people like reading about crime. The top-selling English-language author of all time is:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Agatha Christie

questions.question: What was the name of the handsome, selfish teacher in Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Professor Gilderoy Lockhart

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Harry Potter and Harry
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, pink, gryffindor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Does Harry arrive at Privet Drive with Dumbledore in the first book of the Harry Potter series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: In the Harry Potter series, who created the Ravenclaw House when Hogwarts was built?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rowena Ravenclaw

questions.question: In Harry Potter and the Philosophers Stone, after getting off the Hogwarts Express, how did Harry and his fellow First Years get to the castle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: by boat across the lake

questions.question: Who saved Harry from Voldemort in the Forbidden Forest in the first volume of the Harry Potter series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Firenze

questions.question: Who killed Dumbledore in Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Professor Snape

questions.question: Who gave Dudley a pigs tail using a pink umbrella in the book Harry Potter and the Philosophers Stone?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rubeus Hagrid

questions.question: What was the name of the child who delivered Ron his parcels in Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nigel

questions.question: Filch is a wizard in the Harry Potter books.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What house was Cho Chang in, as explained in Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, Order of the Pheonix, and Goblet of Fire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ravenclaw

questions.question: In Harry Potter and the Philosophers Stone, who gave Nearly-Headless Nick the rejection letter from the Headless Hunt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Patrick Delaney-Podmore

questions.question: In Harry Potter and the Philosophers Stone, Severus Snape bewitches Harrys broom during the Quidditch match between Gryffindor and Sytherin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who took over the Fat Ladys job after she was scared out of her portrait in Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Cadogan

questions.question: Who lost the list of passwords for the Gryffindor tower in Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neville Longbottom

questions.question: In Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince, who was bitten by the werewolf Fenfir Greyback?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill

questions.question: What is James Potter called by Lily Evans in Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A selfish, bullying toerag
